summary: Worker fails to start when using a custom data converter that encrypts payloads. The worker cannot decode the encrypted workflow initialization payload, as the PHP SDK lacks support for custom payload encodings in the worker initialization process.
userImpact: Users cannot use custom data converters with encrypted payloads because workers fail to initialize when receiving encrypted workflow execution payloads.
rootCause: The SDK's worker initialization process does not respect or support custom data converters when decoding the initial workflow definition payload, only supporting known encodings like 'json/plain' and 'binary/plain'.
proposedFix: Modify the worker initialization logic to use the configured data converter when decoding payloads instead of only supporting hardcoded encodings.
workaround: Check for specific workflow initialization payload structure and skip encryption for those payloads while encrypting actual workflow input/output data.
resolutionDetails: Issue was closed after discussion; likely resolved through implementation of custom converter support in worker initialization or documentation of the workaround pattern.
keyQuote: encoding binary/encrypted: payload encoding is not supported
